TopicTitle: What will be the first thing you will do in 0.23?

Articles.Content:
Open my save game!

I see you haven't read the OP.

I'm going to try doing career mode stock (last time I skipped that). I like the new science changes, so it should be a lot more fun now (I wasn't fond of the "spamming science" way of doing things).

Meanwhile I'll make a Sandbox save and try out the RAPIER engines. I want to make a "stock craft" with the RAPIER engines, if there isn't one already. What I mean by that is low part count, funny description, no part clipping, very simple.
I will wait for mechjeb to be available in .23...
I'm updating my engine chart. Mostly done. Until then, the one in my sig line is only v. 0.22.

The first thing I did was test my theory on my three-mission tech tree maximizing for 0.23. Results thus far: so very doable. Missions one and two combined got me over 2,500 science without ever leaving the Kerbin system, and of course mission 3 has the potential to get me far more even at that. I really like the new "gather data" option in EVA. Saves me a load of trouble and removes the "need" for science spam.

Since I'm fairly new to the game as a whole. I am continuing with my career mode. I had to bring one lander back from the Mun to finish out all the science there.

So, my first official new mission in .23 was send a probe out to Minmus with Mapsat on it. I was able to test out my rocket design (feasible) and also see if mapsat waw still working (still works).

So all in all this was a pretty successful first day in the new release.

First thing I will do is see how high I can get a rocket to go, consisting of parachute-mk1pod-small srb, by tweaking the maximum thrust. My theory is that by limiting the thrust, the SRB will burn longer and won't work so hard pushing through the lower atmosphere.

I got to 44,170 m with thrust limited to 37.5% (TWR=2), and 47,265 m with thrust limited to 32.5% (TWR=1.75)

I raced to the new science module as fast as I was able.

Also I installed Kethane for the first time ever. Double the excitement! I'm kind of glad I waited on it as long as I did, I'm finding it quite polished.

Edited December 18, 2013 by PTNLemay

I see you haven't read the OP.

Not sure where the "OP" is; feel free to direct us to it.

However, the first thing I did was open my saved game in career mode. Checked all my stations with "perma-docked" buggy docking ports. They still won't work, I'm assuming they only work correctly when used in a new save file. Everything else looks pretty fluid.

I'll be launching a new lab to my Kerbin Science Station.

Even though there is no science left around Kerbin - it will be fun.

Not sure where the "OP" is; feel free to direct us to it.

OP just means "original post", the first post in the thread. He's implying you only half-attentively read what the thread-starter posted.

Strap a plane onto the side of a rocket and tweak the thrust so it doesn't go all flippy like off the pad.

And Here it is!
... wait some days for mod updates

Sending rover based labs to planets. For science!!! Oh wait, how much science will I need to unlock this?

Well, the lab is not as powerful for just data transmission, but it can reset science. That gives some interesting possibilities... Now not sure what's better: lab-rover or orbital lab + reusable lander

start career from scratch

Same here.

...and say goodbye to all those hard-earned 0.22 ribbons... *sniff*
